title: cabron
author: cabron
content: Cast your bet in a match that have yet not started or bet when the game is already live?It must have been asked before but in case new sports bettors have not yet read such thread, reply back your opinion about it.Found myself losing when the money line changes from 1.75 to 4.35 as the game began. But sometimes when I also wait for the game to start, it changes to worse such from 1.75 to 1.10

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Quote from: cabron on June 25, 2023, 05:57:28 PMCast your bet in a match that have yet not started or bet when the game is already live?It must have been asked before but in case new sports bettors have not yet read such thread, reply back your opinion about it.Found myself losing when the money line changes from 1.75 to 4.35 as the game began. But sometimes when I also wait for the game to start, it changes to worse such from 1.75 to 1.10I prefer going live for a match that is likely to end 0-0 at half time and then waiting until it gets to 60 mins and going in for over 0.5 goals if the game is still goaless at 60mins, the least odd you can get at this time is BTW 1.50- 1.57 depending on the league, most top leagues offer 1.50 in this case. That's a 50% return on your investment, and it works for me 80% of the time. It's a great strategy, but it takes time. It will not make you rich immediately, but your chances of winning are always 95-98%. If the money line is less than 1.30, it climbs to 1.50-1.80 if the game is still goaless after 30 minutes, however live matches are good if you are only staking on a single game. If you want to run a multibet, place your bet before the game begins.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: If you think a club or a team would win a certain match, you can wait for the live matches to start, the longer it takes to score the first goal, the higher the odds become. This is what I like going for with in-play matches. For other in-play, I do not like going for them. People should be careful of in-play matches, they are faster to win, which means to lose too is faster. And losing is very common.What can be most dangerous in in-play are underdog that may be winning with like 2 goals, the big team losing odd will be increasing and the small team odd will be decreasing. But this does not only happen to big teams. It can be big and big team too, or small and small team or any team. It can happen to any club in a way the winning team will have small odd that may attract gamblers, but many of the rematches go otherwise in a way the gambler might lose.

comments.author: harizen
comments.body: Quote from: cabron on June 25, 2023, 05:57:28 PMFound myself losing when the money line changes from 1.75 to 4.35 as the game began. But sometimes when I also wait for the game to start, it changes to worse such from 1.75 to 1.10As a sports bettor, you should really expect that change of line while the match is approaching. Especially, of course, in live betting.But I'm more curious about your example. Do you mean the moment the game began, the pre-match odds from @1.75 turned to @4.35? As in when the game began? The jump of odds is quite distant and these are the possible scenarios that I think happened to your concern:- Maybe the status of those players under "game-time decision" or what would be called it in other sports, are now officially out when the game starts? But for that huge gap of odds when the game began, maybe those players are really key players or a "big deal" on that team- Or maybe, you just think that the line moves when the game began but actually, the game was already started, maybe several minutes ago, and it was an early dominance by either one of the teams resulting in that quick jump of odds in the "live betting".Personally, I don't have a single preference on whether to bet only in pre-match odds or during a live bet. Hey, both are worth trying.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: If I don't have the time to watch the game (which I don't most of the time), I just leave a bet on the game on lines that I think would retain more value than other lines. If I have time, I prefer to bet on live and cash out immediately when I see that something is about to go wrong on my bet - kinda like preventing a loss before it occurs. Most casinos allow that on live bets and it's one of the safest ways to make money on sports betting that not a lot of people are aware of.

comments.body: It all depends on the odds and the capital you are willing to put out for it that's what sport bet, on days that I have more capital to gamble and I am not looking to take risk in my selection, I bet on the odd I believe is most likely to play out and then stake on it. In cases where I have little Capital and actually want to make more out of the game, I wait let the game start playing out and then I stake on the best possibility that had increased odds after the game has started.

But sometimes when I also wait for the game to start, it changes to worse such from 1.75 to 1.10Usually it's not so good to bet when matches have started because live bets have often big margins, so odds can drop from 1.75 to 1.71 for example just because the scheduled time of the beginning of the match has been reached, even if players haven't started to do anything. Bets with fix odds allow you to bet at the current instant without having to think about how actual probabilities will change till the beginning (or till the end if live betting is available) of the match.
